text.section: By regulation, the Secretary shall stagger the terms of the licenses.
Unless a license is renewed for a 2-year term as provided in this section, the license expires on the day that the Secretary sets.

A licensee periodically may renew the license for an additional 2-year term, if the licensee:
otherwise is entitled to be licensed;
pays to the Secretary:
a renewal fee of:
$200, if the licensee is an individual; or
$400, if the licensee is a firm; and
any late fee required under § 13-309 of this subtitle; and
submits to the Secretary:
a renewal application on the form that the Secretary provides; and
the statements required under § 13-309 of this subtitle.
The Secretary shall renew the license of each licensee who meets the requirements of this section.
